title: Amelia Island resort gives families a chance to vie free...
text:
Families can still battle it out for a free vacation on Amelia Island. The Omni Amelia Island Plantation Resort continues its Great Family #OmniAmeliaChallenge, offering multi-generational guests the chance to work as a team to receive a free two-night return stay to the oceanfront resort.
Visitors are asked to participate in the resort’s family-friendly recreational offerings within two days when they book the package. Activities include kayaking, stand-up paddle boarding, Segway touring, miniature golf, spa treatment, tennis lessons and golf. The challenge is designed to promote family bonding.
Families can compete in various activities, including kayaking, at Omni Amelia Island Plantation Resort for a chance to win a free vacation. Contributed Families are urged to share their experiences on social media, promoting to friends that “family is fun!” Guests who successfully complete all elements of the challenge and share at least five experiences on social media using #OmniAmeliaChallenge will automatically win a two-night return stay to the resort.
The Great Family #OmniAmeliaChallenge continues through Aug. 31.
For more details, call 800-The-Omni or visit www.omniameliaislandplantation.com .
Kristian Bush of Sugarland will kick-off 2015 Island Hopper Songwriter Festival Sept. 17 at South Seas Island Resort on Captiva Island. Contributed CAPTIVA
Songwriter Festival stars and discounted resort rate
Country music lovers, take note! Grammy Award-winning recording artist Kristian Bush of Sugarland will kick off the 2015 Island Hopper Songwriter Festival at South Seas Island Resort on Captiva Island. Expect Bush to sing songs from his debut solo album, Southern Gravity, released earlier this year. The festival begins Sept. 17.
Construction continues on a new 94-room adults-only Lanai tower, featuring a rooftop pool, restaurant at the Marco Island Marriott Beach Resort, Golf Club & Spa. Contributed Other performers at the 10-day festival throughout Sanibel and Fort Myers include country rock band Parmalee and Jana Kramer and performances from more than 50 songwriters who have written songs for top country artists including Faith Hill, Garth Brooks, Rascal Flatts, Brad Paisley and Toby Keith.
Discount rates are being offered for those who book accommodations at the South Seas for the festival. Rates start from $135 per night, a 20 percent savings. For reservations, call 800-533-5553 or visit www.southseas.com . For more information about the festival, visit www.fortmyers-sanibel.com/island-hopper .
ORLANDO
Labor Day weekend at Grande Lakes includes a complimentary fireworks show over Grande Lake and poolside fun at the JW Marriott Orlando lazy river. Contributed Celebrate summer promotion
There’s still time to cash in on the Celebrate Summer promotion at Grande Lakes Orlando. The deal includes 15 percent savings on room rate and a $25 nightly resort credit, with nightly room rates at the JW Marriott Orlando starting at $169, and $199 at The Ritz-Carlton Orlando until September.
Families who book a suite-stay or Club Level accommodations at The Ritz-Carlton Orlando can also enjoy complimentary access to Ritz Kids Club, home to Jean-Michel Cousteau’s Ambassadors of the Environment nature-based children’s program.
Labor Day weekend at Grande Lakes includes a complimentary fireworks show over Grande Lake and poolside fun at the JW Marriott Orlando lazy river.
Grande Lakes is also home to The Ritz-Carlton’s popular 40,000-square-foot spa. For reservations or information, visit www.GrandeLakes.com .
MARCO ISLAND
Resort reopens as transformation begins
The Marco Island Marriott Beach Resort, Golf Club & Spa re-opened after being closed for three months to kick off the start of its multi-phase property transformation.
The resort is preparing to convert to a JW Marriott brand resort in 2017. The property, which is undergoing a $250 million expansion, is moving ahead to its second phase of developments and renovations, which will continue during the next 16 months.
The completed first phase includes expanded pool decks, refurbished lobby and a new porte cochere and grand front entrance. Travelers will find refreshed décor and furnishings, along with a redesign and reconfiguration of the guest room bathrooms allowing for larger shower, vanity and private water closet.
The expansion will continue on the all-new Calusa and Banyan ballrooms with technologically advanced event space. Construction will continue on the new 94-room adults-only Lanai tower, featuring a rooftop pool, restaurant with celebrity chef and the 12,000-square-feet state-of-the-art indoor entertainment center on the south side of the property.
For more information or reservations, call 800- GET- HERE (1-800-437-4373) or visit www.marcoislandmarriott.com .
